meanings.definition: A citrus-based sauce used in Japanese cuisine.
meanings.sent1: I poured ponzu over my salad for a tangy flavor.
meanings.sent2: The chef drizzled ponzu on top of the sushi for extra taste.
meanings.sent3: The ponzu sauce danced on my taste buds with its citrusy zing.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a splash of ponzu, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The ponzu sauce was as refreshing as a cool breeze on a hot day.

meanings.definition: To marinate or season with ponzu sauce.
meanings.sent1: I like to ponzu my chicken before grilling it.
meanings.sent2: She decided to ponzu the vegetables before roasting them.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally ponzu-ed the wrong dish, creating a unique flavor combination.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to ponzu the conversation, adding a hint of excitement.
meanings.sent5: The music ponzu-ed the atmosphere, making everyone want to dance.
